I want to share my feelings and experiences with someone who can genuinely listen

[Teacher]: other people. The girls have been friends since they were young children, as well as their parents who were high school sweethearts. The conversation that night was a reminder of the kind of music that Paul McCartney and his band had been playing that evening. The girls talked about their favorite Beatles songs and how much they loved listening to their music. They talked about how the girls parents would always play Beatles songs when they were kids and how they would sing along. The girls parents were high school sweethe

[Teacher]: . Paul had learned a lot by working in a charity center for a while and it was his first time working in a group of people who were older than him, which gave him valuable lessons in terms of communication skills, teamwork, and leadership skills. He had learned that he was a good leader and that he could make a difference in the lives of others. He had learned that he was a good leader and that he could make a difference in the lives of others. He had learned that he was
[Student]: the best player in rock n roll club and the worlds most successful rock musical organ and performed with the same standards as other musicians in rock n roll clubs around the countryside who liked to mix punk and jazz sounds with everyone including himself at different places because of these new ideas made from many different styles and ways of thinking about alternative rock culture with more experience and contemporary genres like Soul Motown Mode which became known as The Big Song In 1985 he got a
[Teacher]: chance to play with the famous rock band Guns N' Roses. He started playing with the band for a while, but then he had to leave because he had a different vision for the music and the band. He had a vision for the music that was more experimental and more experimental than what the band was currently doing, and he decided to pursue his own music and create his own sound. He started playing with other musicians and formed his own band, which he called the Red Hot Chili Peppers.

chance to play with the famous rock band Guns N' Roses. He started playing with the band for a while, but then he had to leave because he had a different vision for the music and the band. [Teacher]: to her. — The two girls were talking and laughing and looking very happy together, and as they walked by we saw a large portrait of a young man hanging on the wall. — The young man was a tall, dark-haired man with a handsome face and a sad expression. — The young man had been to the church on Sundays, he had been to the choir, and he had been to the socials. — The young man had been to the church on Sundays, he had been to
[Student]: the churchyard when his mother died suddenly from pneumonia before he could remember itand now he knew how important everything would be to him if only she were safe enough
[Teacher]: for him to take care of her. — The young man had been to the church on Sundays, he had been to the churchyard, he had been to the church, he had been to the churchyard where his mother had died, and he had been to the church again on the Sunday when he had gone to take care of her and had found the house empty and the door locked. — The young man had been to the church on Sundays, he had been to the churchyard where his

STARTER: Do you play any sports or keep active? Have you joined any teams or tried something new lately?
text:
[Starter]: Do you play any sports or keep active? Have you joined any teams or tried something new lately?
[Student]: I was too busy to go over the field and have some practice on it And she laughed with a laugh that seemed to suggest more self indulgence than anything else she had ever seen before in her life as a schoolgirl and an unfriendly personage on that particular day of school for girls who might be really interested in the sports they met there were no teachers at all except divine companionship The other girls were much interested in the games they played during their first year
[Teacher]: of school in the United Kingdom and they started to get the idea that they did not really need to go through with it. They began to make fun of the games and the girls who played them. But they did not really understand how the sports team was formed and how the team members were selected for the games they played. They had no idea of the hard work and discipline required to be a part of the sports team. When the girls started making fun of the games and the girls who played them
[Student]: took turns making a lot of money from various sources so that when the other girls could get together they would like to spend their summer under the sun and after many tests they could earn enough to make it easy for the girls themselves and do what they liked best but it was hard for them to spend most of their time with others and their interests became less important and they felt better about the good times they spent without having to worry about the college matters that occurred before the games ended and so it was no
[Teacher]: wonder that the girls started to make fun of the games and the girls who played them. As they went to the college and saw the college girls playing in the field it was much like what they had done the year before and it seemed to them that the college girls were just like the girls they were the previous year they were interested in games and other activities so the girls who were not interested in the sports did not have to go through with it. This is how the girls started to make fun of

[Teacher]: be able to train and compete for their university and for the sake of their athletic record of course. STARTER: Do you have any pets? How long have you had them, and what do you like most about them?
text:
[Starter]: Do you have any pets? How long have you had them, and what do you like most about them?
[Student]: Is there anything in the house that I can find on my way to school asked Edna anxiously as she looked up from her dresser with a troubled face at the clock which was just beginning to strike four when they reached the doorstep to ask Mr to let the others pass out of their rooms for some lunch before it rang and went down to tell his story again by talking to their mother or father of how they had left the folks and then perhaps he would be home again after
[Teacher]: that. Edna felt a pang in her home as she looked at her family and then at her family's animals that were in the room, an old cat, a golden retriever, and a little kitten who was only six weeks old.  Edna had had pets all her life but she didn't have any right now because of the fact that her parents were going to move to another town and she had been asked to leave the house which she felt was her home. Her parents told her that
[Student]: if she stayed here instead of keeping her own home she wouldnt want to bother them or else she should keep away from them until she could get back where she wanted to go instead of visiting other people or even staying at their houses so far from them and so she said no one knew how lonely she must have been while she lived and never thought to look around for anyone new to come into this world without knowing that the time came quickly enough and so they began to think of these things in order to
[Teacher]: see if she would get married or live with relatives.  So Edna decided to get a pet to go with her as she had always wanted to have a pet.  It was also good for her family.  There was the old cat who was only a year old and had been living in the house for about six months.  There was the golden retriever which was five years old and had been living in the house for ten years as long as anyone could remember.  And there was
[Student]: every reason for Ednas curiosity that Ednas interest did not satisfy her cousins curiosity quite as much as hers did its odd adventures through the small hours of afternoon sewing when at the end she was tired of sitting among the leaves listening to her book read aloud to herself while her grandfather read and heard everything that she heard for many a day from her husbands books when he started off in search of a place in the village for his farmhouse and settled down in a hollow tree near by saying nothing of
[Teacher]: the many stories that had been shared between the family members as they had sat around the fireplace the fire was burning the wood was splintering and falling to the ground and they talked as they were all sitting in the darkness of the evening which still seemed so bright to her.  She had never been to school yet but had always heard the stories and legends of the village which she had heard in her own home from her family members who had told her many things and she had never been to school yet
[Student]: although she often saw the great difference between being kind to everyone but the wonderful thing in times gone by during those few days when she remembered having spent over thirty girls and having made friends in the orphanage whose hearts beat high whenever she happened to mention writing to herself and her family members who lived so close together that she knew how anxious Clara would feel when something very serious happened to her that might give her attention when she saw her coming for help to bring to the household matters of love and friendship she longed
[Teacher]: to help those around her who needed help. While Edna was thinking about the animals that she had in her house, her cousin Mary came over and asked her what it was that she had in the house.  Edna told her about the cat, the dog, and the little kitten who had just been born.  Mary came over to see the kitten and Edna asked her to bring her favorite toy that it could play with.  Edna then asked her family members if they would like

STARTER: Do you have any pets? How long have you had them, and what do you like most about them?
text:
[Starter]: Do you have any pets? How long have you had them, and what do you like most about them?
[Student]: They are very pretty ones
[Teacher]: , and I think you have a wonderful home for them. (Sent via email)  I am a huge pet lover.  I have three cats, all rescues, and two dogs, both rescues as well.  I have had the dogs for five years now, and the cats for about 8 years.  All of my pets are very friendly and love people.  I love them for their companionship, their unconditional love, and their entertaining antics.  What I like most about
[Student]: is animals that live in holes near trees or bushes where rabbits will nibble at them to make their nests useful and safe from harm He went on with his story On Guards Eye which he also narrated how it had happened by accident when they were young in large numbers among the wild beasts of the forest back north of England when hunting deer made the scene seem less attractive than described by Drummus Freedman and other researchers who learned more about the traits
[Teacher]: of the dogs and their ancestors.  He ended with a story about his grandfather's favorite dog, which was named Rufus.  Rufus was a German Shepherd that loved to dig in holes and make his own nests.  Rufus would often leave his holes to go visit his grandfather and bring back sticks and pine needles to decorate his nest.  Rufus was a very intelligent and loving dog that would do anything for his family.  Rufus would also do tricks for treats and was known
[Student]: to be able to help him take care of himself during winter evenings so he could enjoy life in the winter under the trees of Moltenham Forest and sometimes even hunt alone with little game mice and rats until autumn time when wolves might come crawling through the thickets along the way and hide behind squirrels whose cubs lay eggs among the rocks and brush off their furrows or fences while asleep in the daytime when danger threatened and killed many birds and turkeys were being hunted to kill
[Teacher]: them.  He would then go back to the hole where he could enjoy the peace and quiet of his little nest.  His grandfather often said that Rufus was a very special dog.  He was very gentle and loving and had a very strong instinct to dig and make his own nests.  He said that Rufus was a dog like no other and that he was very lucky to have him in their lives.  Rufus would eventually leave the family but he remained a cherished memory in the
[Student]: woods and the forests and lonely places of all sorts of good times with friends and relatives whom he knew and loved in the days he spent with them in his new home in Holland or Switzerland or wherever else he came within striking distance of civilization and without ever meeting them again and enjoying his surroundings and the adventures of the past few months when his father told him that some years before he got into trouble his parents had become an enemy of men and he must first discover why his old acquaintance had been such inf
[Teacher]: atuated with dogs.  The narrator of the story is a German Shepherd Dog with a name, which he did not remember and the story begins with his grandfather saying "I have always said that dogs are very lucky to have us and we dogs are very lucky to have them."  Then the old man began to tell the story of how he became involved in the early days of the Guard Dogs on On Guards Eye  This story is a combination of the early history of the Guard Dogs, the narrator

atuated with dogs. Then the old man began to tell the story of how he became involved in the early days of the Guard Dogs on On Guards Eye  This story is a combination of the early history of the Guard Dogs, the narrator

[Teacher]: depressed on this fine day which is Sunday and on this fine day I am sure that I shall get my dinner on time If I dont get back soon Ill have to tell them they will have to wait for me again But they will be waiting for me for they know me and I know them and they know that Im not going to forget them on this fine day And they will be waiting for me because it is Sunday I will be sure to tell them they will have to wait for me but I wont

[Teacher]: guitars which dont have electronic sounds, making it more difficult for listeners to determine what genre the music is. It can be played on a variety of instruments, but it is most commonly associated with electric guitars and bass, drums, and keyboards. However, some songs also use other instruments such as drums, synthesizers, and even acoustic guitars. Despite its popularity, the music genre is often misunderstood by people. One way to understand the genre is by listening to different songs and artists that belong to this genre

text:

[Teacher]: eternity to her as she entered the house on Saturday afternoon she was not to be seen for at least another two hours after she arrived home. So, I will leave you with these stories and say happy holidays from our house to yours. Wishing you and your family a wonderful time during the holidays, and to those of you who are spending the holidays alone, may your home be filled with love and warmth.
